PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| active layer |
| LiF |
| Al |
| polymers (P1- P7) |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| active layer |
| LiF |
| Al |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |

Explanation:

* ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) is a material commonly used as a transparent conducting film.
* PEDOT : PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) polystyrene sulfonate) is a conductive polymer used in electronics.
* The active layer refers to the layer in a device that is responsible for the desired functionality, in this case, it is likely a semiconductor material.
* LiF (Lithium Fluoride) is a material commonly used as a buffer layer in electronic devices.
* Al (Aluminum) is a material commonly used as a top electrode in electronic devices.
* PC71BM (Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) and PC61BM are organic semiconductor materials commonly used as electron acceptors in organic solar cells.
